page.title: 02The Reservoir,Ravensthorpe.
page.content: Ravensthorpe Reservoir covers l83 acres and is situated N.E. of the village with a causeway crossing over it.It was the first to be built in Northamp- tonshire and was completed in l896.Up to this date all water was supplied by wells.It is fed by the Stowe Brook and has a capacity of 4l4 million gallons of water which supplies Ravensthorpe, Spratton,Long Buckby,Barby,Creaton and Crick.At the eastern end is a dam and a filtration and chlorination plant which at present is being modernised.There is a tunnel running underneath it from Hollowell to Ravensthorpe.The area is made attractive by the trees which were planted at the time of its construction A car park has been built to improve public access but there is local dis- content with the annual charge.There is no access to the small western area as this is a wild life sanctuary.
